title: Adding An Easy Shortcut to the JSHint javascript validator to Visual Studio
body: <p>I went to add <a href="http://travis.servebeer.com/blog.net/2009/08/31/Adding+An+Easy+Shortcut+To+The+JSLint+Javascript+Validator+To+Visual+Studio.aspx">JSLint to my Visual Studio tools</a> and was disappointed that the WSH version has disappeared (or was discontinued). Luckily the new and improved <a href="http://www.jshint.com/">JSHint</a> supports a <a href="https://github.com/jshint/jshint/blob/master/env/wsh.js">WSH wrapper</a>.</p><ol><li><p>Grab <a href="https://github.com/jshint/jshint/">JSHLint</a>.</p></li><li><p>In Visual Studio &#8594; Tools &#8594; External Tools&#8230;</p></li><li><p>Add a new tool with the following field values: </p><dl><dt>Title:</dt><dd>&#38;JSHint</dd><dt>Command:</dt><dd>%systemroot%\system32\cscript.exe</dd><dt>Arguments:</dt><dd>//Nologo "<var>%YourJSHintPath%</var>\env\wsh.js" $(ItemPath)</dd><dt>Initial directory:</dt><dd>"<var>%YourJSHintPath%</var>\"</dd><dt>Use Output window</dt><dd>checked</dd></dl><p><a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/diesel_travis/5716546978/in/photostream/"><img src="http://farm3.static.flickr.com/2267/5716546978_fc85d569c9.jpg" width="500" height="365" alt="JSHint-VSTools-Adding" /></a></p></li><li><p>Open up any *.js file you'd like to validate</p></li><li><p>Select the all new JSHint from your tools menu: </p><p><a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/diesel_travis/5715982755/sizes/o/in/photostream/"><img src="http://farm4.static.flickr.com/3128/5715982755_d6fb3e85dd.jpg" width="500" height="340" alt="JSHint-VSTools-Running" /></a></p></li></ol><p>The output that JSHint provides appears to be much more useful than the old JSLint version as well.</p>
